tldr: The author, Spence Bate, examines the development of Carcinus Maenas, a common crab, from its earliest larval stage, known as Zoea, to the adult form. Bate demonstrates that the changes in the crab's development are gradual and not a sudden transformation. He also explains how the appendages in the larvae become secondary parts of the same organs in the adult crab. Bate's research is supported by illustrations of various developmental stages.
